item.title: Change of perception thanks to Clojure
item.description: It’s been quite some time since I wrote Clojure, probably around 2 months or so. I stumbled upon this blogpost by Connor Mendenhall. Reading it carefully without skimming is really recommended, and fun. It inspired me enough to write my first blogpost in 2019. My first introduction to functional programming was through Scheme and SICP (I am re-reading this book for few years now, it never stops to amaze me). This would be the core concept that would slap me from the back of the head when I started getting my feet wet with Clojure.

item.title: about me
item.description: Hi, my name is Filip Miletic (Phil for many friends around the globe). Best way to contact me is via email: eaxfilip[at]gmail.com Here you can take a look at my CV. You can reach me on IRC phlm@freenode. – I am currently student at Faculty of Organisational Science – Information Systems and Technology, at University of Belgrade. Previously I’ve dropped out of Electrical Engineering at Faculty of Electrical Engineering, where I’ve studied Electronics for 2 years.
